tool_description: Property level data and analytics for publicly traded Real Estate owned/operated by Real Estate Investment Trusts (REITs)
name: REIT Property Data
title: REIT Property Data

api_list.name: property-info-basic
api_list.description: Get basic attributes for a property.

api_list.name: reit-index
api_list.description: Get a list of all available data including which REITs are available, the dates of collection, and the property types found in those REITs. No parameters required.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://reit-property-data1.p.rapidapi.com/reit-index"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "reit-property-data1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://reit-property-data1.p.rapidapi.com/reit-index"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "reit-property-data1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: property-info-premium
api_list.description: Get premium attributes for a property.

optional_parameters.name: attribute
optional_parameters.description: The premium attribute to query. If no attribute is provided, a list of valid attributes is returned.

api_list.name: feature-search
api_list.description: Search for features within distance of a latitude/longitude coordinate pair.

optional_parameters.name: distance
optional_parameters.description: Distance is in meters. Defaults to 5000.

api_list.name: property
api_list.description: Get IDs of properties. Geography and calendar filters are optional.

optional_parameters.name: geo_level
optional_parameters.description:
Must be used with `geo_value` parameter. Used to specify a geography level to restrict search. Valid `geo_level` values include `zip_code`,`state`,`country`, `countygeoid`, and `msageoid`. Example's of different geo_value values are below.

Note - US states and Canadian provinces are referred to by 2 character codes. All other states and provinces use full name designation

Example usage
- `geo_level = zip_code` and `geo_value = 10010` to get all properties for zip code in NYC
- `geo_level = state` and `geo_value = NY` to get all properties for a REIT in New York state
- `geo_level = country` and `geo_value = US` to get all US properties for a REIT

optional_parameters.name: geo_value
optional_parameters.description:
Must be used with `geo_level` parameter. Used to specify a geography level to restrict search. Valid `geo_level` values include `zip_code`, `state`,`country`,`countygeoid` and `msageoid`.  Examples of different geo_value values are below.

Note - US states and Canadian provinces are referred to by 2 character codes. All other states and provinces use full name designation

Example usage
- `geo_level = zip_code` and `geo_value = 10010` to get all properties for zip code in NYC
- `geo_level = state` and `geo_value = NY` to get all properties for a REIT in New York state
- `geo_level = country` and `geo_value = US` to get all US properties for a REIT

optional_parameters.name: qy
optional_parameters.description: This is the Quarter & Year (QY) the data was scraped. Use this parameter to query a specifc collection of data. If no QY is provided, defaults to latest data collection for specified REIT.
